newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Glaxo jumps 5.0 pct on fund bids.
newsitem.headline: India's Glaxo jumps 5.0 pct on fund bids.

text.p: Shares of leading pharmaceuticals firm Glaxo India jumped 17.50 rupees, or five percent, to 349 in afternoon trade on the Bombay bourse on Thursday, traders said.
They said foreign funds were bidders in the stock.
"There's obvious buying interest in the stock," said an analyst at a foreign broking firm, adding that Glaxo was his top recommendation in the pharmaceutical sector.

"It's our top pick in the sector primarily because of the brand equity it commands in the market," he said citing strong distribution network and good earnings growth among other investment positives.
He said the Glaxo shares were also rising probably due to the recent rise in the stock price of Burroughs Wellcome.
Shares of Burroughs have risen more than three percent this week. They were trading 5.0 rupees higher at 344 on Thursday.
"The swap ratio between Burroughs and Glaxo is likely to be be one-for-one," the analyst said. He was referring to Glaxo's medium-term plans to merge Burroughs Wellcome with it.
The two firms have a common top management.
